means: 关于行路（或驾驶）的指示
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯蒂尔绰号，凶恶的人或职业名称，养小公牛者来源于中世纪英语，含义是“小公牛”(bullock)

sentence.Network_en: The rabbis try to steer clear of political questions.
sentence.Network_cn: 拉比们努力避开政治问题。

sentence.Network_en: The book tries to steer you through the maze of alternative therapies.
sentence.Network_cn: 本书旨在就各种非传统疗法为您指点迷津。

sentence.Network_en: Father tried to steer Jim into becoming a musician.
sentence.Network_cn: 父亲想说服吉姆将来当音乐家.

jx.jx_en_mean: take care to avoid or keep away from

lj.lj_ly: his programme steers clear of prickly local issues.
lj.lj_ls: 他的方案避开了棘手的地方问题。

lj.lj_ly: his programme steers clear of prickly local issues.
lj.lj_ls: 他的方案避开了棘手的地方问题。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stīeran, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch sturen and German steuern
Old English stēor, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch stier and German Stier

entry.def: When you steer a car, boat, or plane, you control it so that it goes in the direction that you want.

example.ex: What is it like to steer a ship this size?...
example.tran: 驾驶这么大的船感觉怎么样？

example.ex: When I was a kid, about six or seven, she would often let me steer the car along our driveway.
example.tran: 在我小时候，大概六七岁时，她经常让我在自家的车道上开车。

entry.tran: 引导，指导(某人采取某种行动或态度)
entry.def: If you steer people towards a particular course of action or attitude, you try to lead them gently in that direction.

example.ex: The new government is seen as one that will steer the country in the right direction...
example.tran: 新政府被认为能将国家引向正确的方向。

example.ex: I think you are perfectly correct in trying to steer your mother towards increased independence.
example.tran: 我认为你试图引导你母亲变得更加独立是完全正确的。

entry.def: If you steer someone in a particular direction, you guide them there.

example.ex: Nick steered them into the nearest seats.
example.tran: 尼克将他们领到最近的座位上。

entry.tran: 选择某种做法;采取某种方式
entry.def: If you steer a particular course, you take a particular line of action.

example.ex: Prime Minister Hun Sen has sought to steer a course between the two groups...
example.tran: 洪森首相设法游走于两个集团之间。

example.ex: In nearly all these issues the British steered a middle course.
example.tran: 英国人几乎在所有这些问题上都选择了中间路线。

entry.def: A steer is a bull that has been castrated.
If you steer clear of someone or something, you deliberately avoid them.

example.ex: I think a lot of people, women in particular, steer clear of these sensitive issues.
example.tran: 我认为很多人，特别是女性，都会回避这些敏感问题。

sentences.sentence: "he got a tip on the stock market"

means.word_mean: 1. direct the course; determine the direction of travelling
3. be a guiding force, as with directions or advice;

sentences.sentence: "The teacher steered the gifted students towards the more challenging courses"

auth_sentence.content: Most importantly, its creators steer clear of ostentation.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most importantly, its creators steer clear of ostentation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most importantly, its creators steer clear of ostentation.

auth_sentence.content: Mr Tadic pledges to steer Serbia towards the EU.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr Tadic pledges to steer Serbia towards the EU.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Tadic pledges to steer Serbia towards the EU.

auth_sentence.content: That inner compass we require to steer our life.
auth_sentence.res_content: That inner compass we require to steer our life.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That inner compass we require to steer our life.

sentences.en: She steered the car skilfully through the narrow streets.
sentences.cn: 她熟练地驾驶着汽车穿过狭窄的街道。

jushi.english: We must steer by those horses.
jushi.chinese: 我们要小心地绕过那些马。
